course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Advanced Organic Chemistry II
course.description: Stereochemistry and conformational analysis, reactions of various classes of organic compounds, synthetic organic chemistry, modern methods of synthesis including specific methodologies and multistep complex syntheses.

reviews.author: holymama
reviews.comment_content:
This is Part II of a two semester advanced organic chemistry course designed for postgraduates. This course will provide the understanding necessary to assimilate and remain current with the primary literature of synthetic organic chemistry.

1. Alkylation of Enolates and Other Carbon Nucleophiles
Means for generating enolates from carbonyl compounds
Regioselectivity and stereoselectivity in enolate formation
Oxygen versus carbon alkylation
Solvent effect
Conjugate addition
Alkylation of enamines and imine anions

2. Reactions of Carbon Nucleophiles with Carbonyl Groups
Aldol condensation
Robinson annulation
The Mannich reaction
Acylation
The Wittig reaction
Sulfur ylides

3. Functional Group Interconversion by Nucleophilic Substitution
Conversion of alcohols to alkylating agents
Nucleophilic substitution at saturated carbon
Nucleophilic cleavage of carbon-oxygen bonds in ethers and esters
Interconversion of carboxylic acid derivatives
Electrophilic Additions to Carbon-Carbon Multiple Bonds
Additions to alkenes, allenes, and alkynes
Oxymercuration
Electrophilic sulfur and selenium reagents

4. Electrophilic Additions to Carbon-Carbon Multiple Bonds
Hydroboration
Reactions of organoboranes

5. Concerted Cycloadditions, Unimolecular Rearrangements, and Thermal Eliminations
The Diels-Alder reaction
Dipolar cycloaddition reactions
The Cope and Claisen rearrangements
[2,3]-Sigmatropic rearrangements
The Ene reaction
Unimolecular thermal elimination reactions
β-Eliminations involving cyclic transition state

6. Reactions Involving Transition Metals
Organocopper intermediates
Organopalladium intermediates
Organonickel compounds
Reactions involving rhodium, iron, and cobalt
Organometallic compounds with π bonding
Olefin metathesis reactions

7. Multistep Synthesis
Protective groups & Retrosynthetic analysis
Selected examples of total synthesis
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures are somehow not useful towards your essay and Dai seldom mentioned the details of the essay until the last moment. Yet, the course content can enrich your knowledge in organic synthesis as lots of reagents and mechanisms mentioned in lectures was not covered in UG organic chem courses. You should not miss it if you are a organic chemistry lover.
reviews.comment_grading:
Presentation and discussion about a current research paper (50%)
Essay about a current research topic or a synthetic plan (50%)

Mysterious grading as we didn't receive any feedback, but still can guess that this course has a good grade as it is a PG course :)
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all as you don't need to do any memorization. Just hand in your essay on time and read more research paper related to organic synthesis.
